about_the_game:
Nonentity Galaxy is a rouge-lite light strategy game that includes starship battles, asset management, and dark humor. The player will play as a business investigator who seeks profits for the company and explores business opportunities. Using limited resources and infighting in the field work, dealing with the worst things that can be seen, and seeking a way to survive in this gray era, and even keep some dignity. Good thing you got your buddies. Life goes on.

—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————

Magnificent megastructures, busy space stations, fleets that flow endlessly.

Beneath the prosperity, there are countless sufferings and sacrifices of ordinary people.

The superficial civilization covers the space with the hottest sunlight; and those shameful businesses that secretly support the operation of civilization go far away along the veins of the Milky Way, hiding in corners that do not disturb civilization, and silently devoting themselves.

When the star rings and Dyson clouds that represent civilization shrink into dim spots; when the sun's light gradually dims, when the eager heart is filled with cold vacuum;

You will remember again that the universe is not a place for people.

Just like the popular aerospace advertisement:

"United Aerospace, money pays money, life pays life."

—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————

"Hey, it's hell."

-If you can't reach an agreement, just start fighting! The fleet can be micro-managed or intelligently taken over to kill the enemy fleet with the least sacrifice.

-Freely choose the operating functions, combat cores, and the size of the rented fleet for field work. The fewer you choose, the more money you will get. You can decide for yourself.

-Buy a powerful private fleet, let the company's assets die first, and make your own assets bigger and bigger.

-Fleet formation and module combination. A perfect formation can greatly improve the combat effectiveness of the fleet (and aesthetics), and loading advanced modules can completely change the function of the starship.

-Adjust asset allocation at any time. The ultimate goal of the company is to make money, and rare items are much more valuable than starships and modules. In field work, choose whether to pocket funds or increase combat effectiveness according to your needs.

-Run away if you can't win, it's not shabby. You can escape at any time during field work. Although it will damage the bonus share, it is better than being wiped out.

-Find joy in suffering. People with a bad mentality in this damn place have been finished long ago. The extremely black humorous plot story is scattered throughout the game. While smiling knowingly, you can understand the daily life in the dark corners.

- Rest after the war. Configure assets in the space station and order a drink. We are all wanderers in the world, so why not chat with each other when we meet?

—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————

content_descriptors.notes: Pain caused by common space diseases and drugs used to treat them. Psychological problems caused by social pressure and common means of counseling. Financial related illegal acts and their legal consequences. These topics are addressed in the story, but not directly in the gameplay.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:

  • Processor: Dual-core 2.5 GHz or equivalent
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated GPU, 1 GB VRAM/ AMD HD5750 or equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Minimal resolution: 1280*720
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10+ (32/64 bits)
  • Processor: Core i3 2,5 GHz or equivalent
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated GPU, 2 GB VRAM / GTX 750ti or equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Recommended resolution: 1920x1080
